intro: Halostachys ritteriana, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that produces small, yellow flowers resembling those of the dandelion. The plant has small, narrow leaves and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Halostachys ritteriana is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its native range.
